description.narrative: Transforming the market for energy efficient motors used in SMEs and promoting investment in industrial EE in Turkey to support this transition. Developing legislation, appropriate governance mechanisms, information structure, upgrading test authorities

comment.narrative:
Project Objective: To promote significant additional investment in industrial energy efficiency in Turkey by transforming the market for energy efficient motors used in small and medium sized enterprises. Lifetime direct project CO2 emission reductions from the replacement of inefficient motors with IE3 motors by end-of-project (EOP), ktonnes CO2 0 MWh of annual reduced electricity consumption in Turkey through the installation and use of EE motors installed during the Project by EOP 0 % of SMEs with firm plans to procure and install EE motors by using the financial mechanism developed by the Project by EOP >0.1% Cumulative number of phased out inefficient electric motors taken into a recycling program by EOP 0 Outcome 1: Strengthened legislative and regulatory framework related to both new and existing EE motors in Turkey
Number of completed national surveys on motors in the industrial sector in Turkey by Year 1 0 Number of Turkish policies, regulations and standards applicable to motors harmonized with EU Eco-design standards by Year 1 0 Number of government officers who are involved with implementing policies and measures for EE motor replacement programmes by EOP 0 Outcome 2: Improved capacity of relevant stakeholders to promote the benefits of EE motors
Number of electric motor manufacturers registered and engaged with promotional activities with an established national motor manufacturer association by EOP 0 Number of attendees at 20 technical training seminars on EE motors that are targeted for manufacturers and end-users by EOP 0 Outcome 3: Improved capacity for monitoring, verification and enforcement of motors market transformation Number of TSI personnel who are testing compliance with new EE motor eco-design standards by EOP 0 Number of DGSIIP personnel who are involved in PMSP for EE motors compliance in industrial SMEs by EOP 0 Annual number of motors sent for testing at upgraded TSI motor testing facilities by EOP 0 Outcome 4: One-stop

- Designing the data base for market survey for electric motors in Turkey. - Study and report on legislation for used motors and new commers as well as in domestic market and import motors. - Preparation of electric motor market report and business plan for EMOSAD board management - Capacity buikding of EMOSAD. - Market surveliance and TNA report for MoIT and TSE. - Preparation for tendering procees of TSE electric motor test lab upgrade investment. - Producing website, brochures and social media accounts for awareness raising. - Generating financial modality for pilot motor replacement phase. - Selection and confirmation of OIZs by MoIT for pilot motor replacement phase.

- Designing the data base for market survey for electric motors in Turkey initiated and will be completed in 2019. - Study and report on legislation for used motors and new commers as well as in domestic market and import motors completed. - Electric motor market report prepared and business plan for EMOSAD board management - Capacity buikding of EMOSAD completed. - Market surveliance and TNA report for MoIT and TSE prepared. - Tendering procees of TSE electric motor test lab upgrade investment initiated. - Website, brochures and social media accounts for awareness raising prepared. - Generating financial modality for pilot motor replacement phase initiated. - Selection and confirmation of OIZs by MoIT for pilot motor replacement phase initiated and in progress.

- Designing the data base for market survey for electric motors in Turkey. - Upgrading current related legislation according to pıssible revisions to be published by EU auhorities. - Training related MoIT experts in terms of conformity checks and testings through market surveliance approaches. - Finalising purchasing, installation and payment process for new TSE Lab investment. - Setting the incentive and financial model for pilot motor replacement stage. - Outsourcing motor energy efficiency audit consultant company. - Implememtation of energy audits in selected OIZs. - Outsourcing survey analysis consultant company on awaresness level of SMEs about electric motor efficiency.

1. Database for the market survey for electric motors in Turkey designed by the ISC and LSC experts in colloboration with the Implementing Partner, PMU and the relative stakeholders (i.e.TUIK, MoTrade, EMOSAD, OSBUK). Since generating a proper/accurate data has not been rationalized yet from EMOSAD related with local motor production and sales figures, database has not been operated yet. Implementing Partner would show initiative to receive such required data entry figures and in the mean time they requested a virtual dumy data to be created to simulate running of the database. Therefore, the experts will provide a virtual database together with their final report (final deliverable) by the end of 2019. (Outcome 1) 2. No action so far (Outcome 1) 3. Training on Market Surveillance of EE motors and motor driven ErPs for compliance with eco-design requirements was held on 2-3-4 April 2019 in Tuzla. * 28 city/regional inspectorate staff of DGSIIP benefited from the training particularly. * The DGSIIP and the project partner TSE provided remarkable technical input. The practical training provided by TSE at TSE Test Lab training facility delivered the opportunity to increase the knowledge and experience of the delegates in respect of the technicalities and features of electric motors. This was an important objective for the TEVMOT project. (Outcome 3) 4. Installation and payment processes of the TSE Lab investment in the Tuzla TSE facility is targeted to be complete by mid of December 2019. The payment at the cost of 1.2m USD will be realised through the RDP as per the decision of Steering Commitee. There is close follow up of MoIT at senior management level -DG of Industry and DG for Safety and Inspection of Industrial Products. (Outcome 3) 5. As a result of the meetings and discussions between the teams of KOSGEB and DGIP & TEVMOT Project since January 2019, that becomes possible to cooperate with KOSGEB on Energy Efficient Motor Promotion financial support mechanism as per public insentive. Protocol document was prepared by the PMU and DGIP experts and ready to be signed among DGIP and KOSGEB since September 2019.. The protocol document sets the conditions for the implementation of pilot motor replacement programme and the associated co-finance mechanism which constitute a support rate up to 60% or 75% to SMEs (DGIP using the TEVMOT Project resource and KOSGEB will share the support rate equally 30% for import product or 37.5% for domestic product). (Outcome 4) 6. No action so far. As soon as the protocol document with KOSGEB signed, pilot studies will start which will involve the energy audits in the facilities of willing SMEs. As a preparatory effort, the Project is going to organize a technical workshop on the 8th November, 2019 in Ankara in order to identify the methodology of how to perform energy efficient motor audits in willing SMEs in selected OIZs. Relevant stakeholders and Project partners i.e.EYODER, EVCED, Project partner local motor manufacturing companies (AEMOT, VOLT, WAT, GAMAK), EMOSAD are expected to participate. 7. No action so far. 8. The RFQ document is being prepared, the Procurement is targeted for the last quarter of 2019. (Outcome 1)

1. Project launch under the auspices of our Minister. 2. Completing the efficient motor field perception survey, evaluating its outputs and reflecting them on awareness raising and promotion activities. 3. Organizing a half-day “Information Day Seminar“ in each of the OIZs that have signed a cooperation protocol. 4. Provision of SMEs wishing to take part in efficient motor survey audits and motor change studies of the pilot phase of the Project. 5. Identification of the first 100 of the listed SMEs with the KOSGEB support procurement legislation and the maximum energy saving potential.6. Preparation of letters of intent between the identified 100 member SMEs and the OIZ administrations. 6. Project resources will be met and OIZ service procurement procedures within the framework of DGIP final approval of procurement services to be carried out internal studies. 7. Designation of EVD firms for survey EE audit services to be met with project resources and to be realized upon the final approval of DGIP within the framework of OIZ service procurement procedures. 8. Determining the EE audit schedule for each SME and conducting the audit studies. 9. Technical and financial eligibility check and compliance of the motor list to be changed as a result of the audit studies on SME basis. 10. Ensuring that the companies decided to benefit from the project resources supported by KOSGEB can apply for support. 11. Ensuring motor replacements over the resources defined within the DGIP-KOSGEB protocol, taking the inefficient motors out of the factory and ensuring their recycling. 12. Conducting studies on the application of energy efficiency label of equipment / industrial enterprise with EMOSAD, 13. Carrying out sample motor tests for market survey in TSE Gebze new test lab according to the protocol signed among GDIP and TSE. 14. Carrying out general publicity and awareness raising activities.

1. Per the MoU between the KOSGEB and MoIT, through which the Motor Replacement Financial Support Programme for the SMEs entered into effective in Jan20 for the 2 years time period The Programme for the 7 Pilot OIZs was launched by the Minister in Jan20 during OSBUK Summit through mass media means. 2. There were delays in finalization of the procurement of survey company service to measure the level of awareness of SMEs towards the EE motors due to high price quotes received on the first RFQ notice and also the ToR had to be revised to adapt to the to Covid19 measures. Nevertheless, the Procurement is finalised and the company is selected. Survey implementatio will start in coming months. 3. “InfoDay Seminars“ in each of the OIZs were held early this year. Signing of Protocols between MoIT and 7 Pilot OIZs delayed, and the formal signing is still in process due to mainly the institutional restructuring of the IP and change of DG. Nevertheless, the field implementation started de-facto per the Protocols -except Bursa OIZ. 4. SMEs who declared to be beneficiery of the motor replacement programme were selected upon one-to-one meetings and briefings with 120 companies from 7 OIZs. Main and Reserve lists were prepared accordingly in cooperation with the pilot OIZ. 100 SMEs are targeted for conducting the energy audits (pre-and detailed) before the replacement (Target 4 & 5). 5. Procurement of energy audit services from EVD companies have been finalised by the 6 OIZs and the audits started in the beneficiery SMEs. %65 of walk-through audits and %40 of detailed audits have been realised by the EVD companies in 65 SMEs as of October 2020 in line with the OIZ Protocol and proejct requirements. In the meantime templates of Motor efficiency investment plans (MEEIPs) and standard motor testing reports (SMTRs) were prepared by the Project as a guide tool for the EVD companies at start of their service . Also, technical knowledge capacities of Energy Audit companies (EVDs) and Energy Management Units (EMUs) of the pilot OIZ and motor producers were raised through intensive online trainings on motor systems audit methodology and the Projects audit procedures for EVDs in SMEs (Target 6 & 7) 6. The Project hired a full time SC base Project Field Coordinator who started in September and immediately designed a field activity monitoring tablet o track the status of audit schedules for each SMEs. The Project follows an aggressive plan to complete all the audits in 100 SMEs by the end of 2020. 7. As of October 2020, for the 3 SMEs whose audit process finished and reports are approved, the Project team completed the technical and financial eligibility check and compliance of the motor list. These SMEs are in the stage of having proforma motor invoices and replacement. Additionally, the cross check of eligibility of 100 SMEs for the KOSGEB finance programme has been made with KOSGEB (Target 9 & 10) 8. Towards end of the year, the Project will concentrate on designing waste management (recycling) programme in accordance with the Regulation on Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) transposing the WEEE Directive of the EU through a professional expert consultancy. (Target 11) 9. There was no concrete result with regards to cooperation with EMOSAD thus, no studies conducted with regards to EE labeling. (Target 12) 10. Progress is made on purchase of 40 sample motors (Phase I) for testing procedures within the scope of market screening activities and increased Lab capacity of TSE. (Target 13) 11. TEVMOT website is under costruction for improvement. In terms of awareess raising, the Project conducted series of online capacity building trainings on motor systems audits for the relevant stakeholders such as energy audit companies, OIZ energy units, motor producers. These trainings were all live stream open to public and for certification for those successful in the exams. Broader audience benefited from these trainings via Facebook tevmot account. EMSA Motor systems Audit Guide which is a remarkable publication for the EE sector has been translated into Turkish and soon become e-publication of the MoIT through the Project. Also, the Project hired a Local Communication and Media Expert to enhance the awareness raising campaign to achieve impactful activities with the relevant stakeholders.(Target 14)

1. Total of 650 motors in 100 SMEs in 7 Pilot OIZs replaced though the TEVMOT-KOSGEB motor replacement finance support programme. 2. KOSGEB Replication plan using OIZs as One-Stop-Shop is designed and approved by the Implemening partners. The plan targets SMEs in additional 20 OIZs benefiting from the energy audits and KOSGEB replacement programme in the sceario if KOSGEB increases the funding. 3. Dissemination plan for Turkey wide SMEs is desgined and approved by the Implementing partners. The plan also targets formation of investment alternatives (i.e.suitable loan and leasing) for SMEs within the TurSEFF (EBRD) programme, and/or possible cooperation frames with AFD and IFC. 4. Waste management (recycling) programme is implemented in accordance with the Regulation on Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) of EC. 5. Survey to measure the awareness level of SMES towards the EE motors is conducted in 12 cities and analysis is prepared. Results to be basis for setting necessary policies and standards related to EE motor market transformation and also key messages fort he awareness raising campaign. 6. EMOSAD is included in the Project activities through a clear action plan. These activities are mainly related to market monitoring database (see 4), EE labeling and awareness raising. 7. A market monitoring database for the electric motors starts operating in cooperation with EMOSAD. 8. Awareness raising campaign is designed taking into account of the key messages out of the survevy analysis results and start the campaig in harmony with the dissemination plan. 9. Phase II -40 sample motorsa are purchased and tested in the TSE premises within the scope of upgraded MV&E.

1. Total of 254 motors in 33 SMEs in 7 Pilot OIZs replaced though the TEVMOT-KOSGEB motor replacement finance support programme. 2. KOSGEB will increase the funding in 2022, it is planned to be declared a new finance mechanism including energy audits and motor replacements within all cities in Turkey. One-Stop-Shop concept was cancelled. 3. Dissemination plan for Turkey wide SMEs was studied to be designed. Plan was cretaed but has not been approved, yet. Tevmot Project Dissemination Phase will be integrated to the new finance mechansim of KOSGEB in the beginning of 2022. New finance mechansim of KOSGEB is expected to be declared. 4. Waste management (recycling) programme was started to be implemented in accordance with the Regulation on Waste Electrical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) of EC. Inefficient 43 motors were sent to the recycling. 5. Survey was decided to be transformed to a market survey to measure demand, sales, production and import quantities of the energy efficient motors. It has been targeted to be carried out in 2022. 6. EMOSAD was included in the Project activities for the motor replacements of the Pilot Phase. Price lists of the motors for each brand in the market were shared by EMOSAD to check the invoices. Besides technical solutions related to some motor replacements in some SMEs were discussed with EMOSAD. 7. In cooperation with EMOSAD, market monitoring database for the electric motors has been targeted to start operating in 2022. 8. Awareness raising campaign plan was designed and has started to be implemented. 9. Motor Testing Programme Phase II - 29 sample motors were purchased. They are planned to be tested n the TSE premises within the scope of new legislation.
